intro: Alyxia stellata f. marquesensis, commonly known as the Marquesan star vine, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, star-shaped white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. This variety is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its limited distribution and ornamental value.
